channel.title: Concepts of ocamlyacc on Documentation for Hugo Learn Theme

item.title: Languages
item.description: Languages and Context-Free Grammars In order for Ocamlyacc to parse a language, it must be described by a context-free grammar. This means that you specify one or more syntactic groupings and give rules for constructing them from their parts. For example, in the C language, one kind of grouping is called an expression'. One rule for making an expression might be,An expression can be made of a minus sign and another expression''.
